briefdescription.para: Invalid arguments (NULL pointer, size mismatch, etc.).
Failed to open a required file.
Failed to read from a required file.
Encountered an unexpected magic number or version.
Encountered an invalid or unsupported on-disk format.

detaileddescription.para: These codes are returned by functions that manipulate block-sparse matrices, in particular ie_block_sparse_load. They are designed to be lightweight and sufficient for logging and error propagation.
These codes are returned by functions that manipulate block-sparse matrices, in particular ie_block_sparse_load. They are designed to be lightweight and sufficient for logging and error propagation.

briefdescription.para: In-memory representation of a block-sparse matrix.

detaileddescription.para: This structure contains all metadata and storage required to perform matrix-vector products in block-sparse form. It is owned by the caller; loader functions such as ie_block_sparse_load will allocate and populate the arrays and can later be released using ie_block_sparse_release.

Lifetime rules:
All pointer fields are either NULL (when nnzb is zero) or point to heap-allocated memory obtained via malloc.
After a successful load, the caller must eventually call ie_block_sparse_release on the descriptor.
After release, the descriptor is left in a zeroed state and may be reused or safely destroyed.

briefdescription.para: Human-readable description of an ie_sparse_status_t code.

simplesect.para: Pointer to a static, NUL-terminated string describing the status.
The returned pointer is valid for the lifetime of the process and must not be freed by the caller.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a block-sparse matrix descriptor to a safe empty state.

detaileddescription.para: This function does not allocate any memory. It only sets all fields to zero or NULL, making the descriptor safe to pass to ie_block_sparse_release or to any loader function that expects an initially empty descriptor.

parameterdescription.para: Descriptor to initialize (may be NULL, in which case this function is a no-op).

briefdescription.para: Release all heap-allocated storage owned by a block-sparse matrix.

detaileddescription.para:
If m is NULL, this function is a no-op. Otherwise it:
Calls free on ie_block_sparse_matrix_t::row_ptr, ie_block_sparse_matrix_t::col_idx, and ie_block_sparse_matrix_t::values when non-NULL.
Resets all scalar fields to zero.
Sets all pointer fields to NULL.
After this call, the descriptor is in the same state as after ie_block_sparse_init and may be reused.

parameterdescription.para: Descriptor whose storage should be released (may be NULL).

briefdescription.para: Compute the theoretical number of block rows for a given layout.

parameterdescription.para: Total number of rows in the dense matrix.
Block height (rows per block, must be >0).

simplesect.para: Number of block rows (ceil(rows / block_rows)), or 0 on invalid input.

briefdescription.para: Compute the theoretical number of block columns for a given layout.

parameterdescription.para: Total number of columns in the dense matrix.
Block width (columns per block, must be >0).

simplesect.para: Number of block columns (ceil(cols / block_cols)), or 0 on invalid input.

briefdescription.para: Compute the logical density (non-zero blocks / total blocks).

detaileddescription.para: The return value is a floating-point fraction between 0.0 and 1.0. If any of the parameters is zero, this function returns 0.0.

briefdescription.para: Load a block-sparse matrix from a binary file.

detaileddescription.para: This function reads the on-disk format defined by the implementation in engine/src/sparse_io.c and populates out with a fully initialized ie_block_sparse_matrix_t instance.

On success:
ie_block_sparse_matrix_t::rows and cols reflect the dense dimensions.
ie_block_sparse_matrix_t::block_rows and block_cols reflect the block layout.
ie_block_sparse_matrix_t::n_block_rows and n_block_cols are derived from the dense dimensions and block sizes.
ie_block_sparse_matrix_t::row_ptr, col_idx, and values are allocated and filled.

On failure:
IE_SPARSE_ERR_* is returned.
out is left in a zeroed / empty state (safe to reuse or release).

path
Filesystem path to the binary block-sparse matrix.
out
Destination descriptor (must not be NULL).
IE_SPARSE_OK on success, error code otherwise.
This function reads the on-disk format described in the file header documentation above and populates out with a fully initialized ie_block_sparse_matrix_t instance.

On success:
ie_block_sparse_matrix_t::rows and cols reflect the dense dimensions.
ie_block_sparse_matrix_t::block_rows and block_cols reflect the block layout.
ie_block_sparse_matrix_t::n_block_rows and n_block_cols are derived from the dense dimensions and block sizes.
ie_block_sparse_matrix_t::row_ptr, col_idx, and values are allocated and filled.

On failure:
IE_SPARSE_ERR_* is returned.
out is left in a zeroed / empty state (safe to reuse or release).

parameterdescription.para: Filesystem path to the binary block-sparse matrix.

simplesect.para: IE_SPARSE_OK on success, error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_block_sparse_matrix_t *m, const float *x, float *y, const float *bias)
memberdef.name: ie_gemv_block_sparse_f32

briefdescription.para: Perform a single-precision block-sparse matrix-vector product.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes: y=W*x(+bias,ifprovided) where W is represented in block-sparse form using ie_block_sparse_matrix_t. The input vector x has length m->cols, and the output y has length m->rows.

Tail blocks:
If the matrix size is not an exact multiple of the block dimensions, the implementation clips accesses to rows and cols, ensuring no out-of-bounds reads/writes occur.

Threading:
This function is intentionally single-threaded. Thread-level parallelism should be managed by higher-level components (e.g., a thread pool).

parameterdescription.para: Block-sparse matrix descriptor (must be fully initialized).
Input vector of length m->cols (must not be NULL).
Output vector of length m->rows (must not be NULL).
Optional bias vector of length m->rows (may be NULL).

briefdescription.para: In-memory representation and loader interface for block-sparse matrices.

detaileddescription.para: This header defines:

listitem.para: The in-memory layout for block-sparse matrices used by the engine (see ie_block_sparse_matrix_t).
A small status-code enum for sparse-related operations (see ie_sparse_status_t).
Utility helpers for computing block grid sizes and densities.
The public loader function ie_block_sparse_load, which reads a compact binary representation into an in-memory descriptor.
A reference single-precision GEMV kernel (see ie_gemv_block_sparse_f32).

detaileddescription.para: The chosen layout is a block-row CSR (BSR):

listitem.para: The full matrix has rows x cols elements.
It is partitioned into blocks of block_rows x block_cols.
Block rows are numbered from 0 to n_block_rows-1, where n_block_rows = ceil(rows / block_rows).
Block columns are numbered from 0 to n_block_cols-1, where n_block_cols = ceil(cols / block_cols).
Only non-zero blocks are stored; zero blocks are omitted.

detaileddescription.para:
Notes:
Tail blocks (on the last block-row/column) may extend beyond the actual matrix dimensions. Consumers must clip accesses using the rows and cols fields.
The on-disk format is defined by the implementation in engine/src/sparse_io.c and consumed via ie_block_sparse_load.
